briefdescription.para: Magic number to determine endianness when reading the Dawg from file.

detaileddescription.para: A special unichar id that indicates that any appropriate pattern (e.g.dicitonary word, 0-9 digit, etc) can be inserted instead Used for expressing patterns in punctuation and number Dawgs.

briefdescription.para: Permuter code that should be used if the word is found in this Dawg.
Returns true if the given word is in the Dawg.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *filename, const UNICHARSET &unicharset, bool enable_wildcard) const
memberdef.name: check_for_words

detaileddescription.para: Checks the Dawg for the words that are listed in the requested file. Returns the number of words in the given file missing from the Dawg.

memberdef.argsstring: (NODE_REF node, UNICHAR_ID unichar_id, bool word_end) const =0
memberdef.name: edge_char_of

briefdescription.para: Returns the edge that corresponds to the letter out of this node.

detaileddescription.para: Fills the given NodeChildVector with all the unichar ids (and the corresponding EDGE_REFs) for which there is an edge out of this node.
Returns the next node visited by following the edge indicated by the given EDGE_REF.
Returns true if the edge indicated by the given EDGE_REF marks the end of a word.

briefdescription.para: Returns UNICHAR_ID stored in the edge indicated by the given EDGE_REF.

detaileddescription.para: Prints the contents of the node indicated by the given NODE_REF. At most max_num_edges will be printed.

memberdef.argsstring: (UNICHAR_ID unichar_id, const UNICHARSET &unicharset, GenericVector< UNICHAR_ID > *vec) const
memberdef.name: unichar_id_to_patterns

detaileddescription.para: Fills vec with unichar ids that represent the character classes of the given unichar_id.

memberdef.argsstring: (EDGE_REF edge_ref, UNICHAR_ID unichar_id, bool word_end) const
memberdef.name: pattern_loop_edge

detaileddescription.para: Returns the given EDGE_REF if the EDGE_RECORD that it points to has a self loop and the given unichar_id matches the unichar_id stored in the EDGE_RECORD, returns NO_EDGE otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns the next node visited by following this edge.
Returns the marker flag of this edge.
Returns the direction flag of this edge.
Returns true if this edge marks the end of a word.
Returns UNICHAR_ID recorded in this edge.
Sets the next node link for this edge in the Dawg.
Sets this edge record to be the last one in a sequence of edges.

memberdef.argsstring: (NODE_REF next_node, bool word_end, UNICHAR_ID unichar_id, const EDGE_RECORD &edge_rec) const
memberdef.name: given_greater_than_edge_rec

detaileddescription.para: Sequentially compares the given values of unichar ID, next node and word end marker with the values in the given EDGE_RECORD. Returns: 1 if at any step the given input value exceeds that of edge_rec (and all the values already checked are the same) 0 if edge_rec_match() returns true -1 otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (NODE_REF next_node, bool word_end, UNICHAR_ID unichar_id, NODE_REF other_next_node, bool other_word_end, UNICHAR_ID other_unichar_id) const
memberdef.name: edge_rec_match

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if all the values are equal (any value matches next_node if next_node == NO_EDGE, any value matches word_end if word_end is false).

memberdef.argsstring: (DawgType type, const STRING &lang, PermuterType perm, int unicharset_size, int debug_level)
memberdef.name: init

detaileddescription.para: Sets type_, lang_, perm_, unicharset_size_. Initializes the values of various masks from unicharset_size_.

memberdef.argsstring: (WERD_CHOICE *word, inT32 index, NODE_REF node, UNICHAR_ID wildcard) const
memberdef.name: match_words

detaileddescription.para: Matches all of the words that are represented by this string. If wilcard is set to something other than INVALID_UNICHAR_ID, the *'s in this string are interpreted as wildcards. WERD_CHOICE param is not passed by const so that wildcard searches can modify it and work without having to copy WERD_CHOICEs.

memberdef.argsstring: (const WERD_CHOICE &word_so_far, NODE_REF to_explore, TessCallback1< const char * > *cb) const
memberdef.name: iterate_words_rec

detaileddescription.para: Abstract class (an interface) that declares methods needed by the various tesseract classes to operate on SquishedDawg and Trie objects.

This class initializes all the edge masks (since their usage by SquishedDawg and Trie is identical) and implements simple accessors for each of the fields encoded in an EDGE_RECORD. This class also implements word_in_dawg() and check_for_words() (since they use only the public methods of SquishedDawg and Trie classes that are inherited from the Dawg base class).
